title: Episode 211: Rules about performance tools
description: In this episode Chet, Romain and Tor chat with Shai Barack about how the Android platform team studies performance and understands system health - and what is system health anyway? We talk about measuring performance, deciding trade-offs, and our favorite tools such as Perfetto, Compiler Explorer, and Android Studio's Memory Profiler.   Chapters: Intro (00:00) System health (0:27) Efforts to make apps more efficient (3:35) Telemetry data (5:59) Trade offs between long battery life and good performance (8:21) Scheduling groups (10:38) Static drain (13:32) Collaborating with App developers vs operating system (19:10) High refresh rates (23:26) Reach vs engagement (32:02) What tools does your team use to optimize performance? (34:10) Godbolt.org (37:09) Demystifying (39:39) The best tools are multi-player (43:52) R8 or R-Not? (45:42) Optimizing for feature sets (48:05) Tools, not Rules (50:08) What are the tools I should be aware of as an app developer looking to upscale performance? title: 254 - 8× faster 5× memory savings with Dan Rusu’s Immutable Arrays
description: In this episode, discover how Dan Rusu’s pods4k Immutable Arrays library can deliver 2–8× speed boosts and 5× lower memory usage in Kotlin/Android apps. title: Android Weekly Issue #661
description: Articles & Tutorials Sponsored Advertise your Android dev course to over 80k readers We reach out to more than 80k Android developers around the world, every week, through our email newsletter and social media channels. Advertise your Android development course! Comparing FileProvider vs. MediaStore + Top Interview Questions Leo N compares Android’s FileProvider and MediaStore, detailing their roles in file sharing and storage, and offers guidance on implementing each within applications. Clip or Cut or Mask a Composable with a Custom Shape Souvik Sarkar demonstrates creating custom shapes and masking user profile pictures within these shapes using the Modifier.drawWithContent function in Jetpack Compose. Simplify ViewBinding in Android with ViewBindingPropertyDelegate 2.0 Kirill Rozov introduces version 2.0 of the ViewBindingPropertyDelegate library, highlighting key changes such as the transition from lifecycle-based to component callbacks, removal of state checks, and updates to the artifact ID and base package. Designing Effective UI Components in Jetpack Compose Jaewoong Eum discusses best practices for designing UI components in Jetpack Compose, emphasizing effective use of modifiers, state management, and creating flexible, reusable components. Kotlin Constants in Android: Top-level vs. Companion-enclosed Aung Thiha analyzes the impact of declaring constants as top-level versus within companion objects in Kotlin, examining their effects on performance, APK size, and memory usage. Creating a Modern Bottom Navigation Bar with a Curved Cut-Out Souvik Sarkar provides a step-by-step guide to designing a modern bottom navigation bar in Jetpack Compose, featuring a curved cut-out for a docked floating action button. A more flexible Checkbox in Material3 Nav Singh shows a new API in Material3 that allows developers to customize the stroke of the checkmark and checkbox outline in Jetpack Compose’s Material3 Checkbox component. Parallelism with Android SQLite Pierre-Yves Ricau explores SQLite’s parallelism limits in Android and suggests strategies to avoid thread contention for better performance. Mesh Gradients in Jetpack Compose sinasamaki shows how to implement beautiful Mesh Gradients on Android. Using Apollo Kotlin in Android Applications - Part I A hands-on course to learn the basics of Apollo Kotlin: set up the SDK, configure code generation, and send your first queries! Libraries & Code KAnalytics KAnalytics is a powerful Kotlin Multiplatform library that streamlines analytics integration across Android and iOS applications. Port flutter features to KMP The new Pebble project is looking for help migrating the mobile app to #Kotlin Multiplatform! News Advent of Code in Kotlin: Winners and Community Highlights JetBrains announces the winners of the Advent of Code 2024 in Kotlin, celebrating participants who excelled in solving algorithmic puzzles and contributed to the community. Meet the Android Studio Team: A Conversation with Jamal Eason Jamal Eason discusses his journey from studying computer science at West Point to his current role, insights on Android Studio’s evolution, and the importance of community engagement in shaping the IDE’s future. Timeline update: third-party autofill services support on Chrome on Android Chrome on Android will support third-party autofill services natively starting from Chrome 135, following developer feedback and timeline adjustments. Tools AYA | Android ADB Desktop App AYA is a open-source desktop application for easily controlling android devices, which can be considered as a GUI wrapper for ADB. Available for Windows, Mac and Linux. Videos & Podcasts Guards in Kotlin 2.1 When expressions have always been powerful, but in Kotlin 2.1 it is becoming even more powerful with guards. Learn more in this video! Automatically Detects Performance Issues in Your Kotlin Apps Learn how to effectively diagnose and solve performance issues in your Koin-powered Kotlin applications using the Kotzilla platform - a new debugging tool specifically designed for applications using the Koin framework How to Get Started With Firebase Test Lab In Android Studio Philipp Lackner shows how you can make use of Firebase Test Lab for your Android app to test your app on various different devices, manufacturers and configurations in the cloud without having to physically possess these devices. How To Create a Kotlin Coroutine Scope INSIDE suspend Functions Yanneck Reiß shows how to create a coroutine scope inside suspend functions in Kotlin to easily launch async tasks! 🔥 NEW: Koin Plugin for IntelliJ & Android Studio - Open Beta Launch! Arnaud Giuliani walks through the open beta of the official Koin Plugin for IntelliJ IDEA and Android Studio that will hopefully make your development experience with Koin smoother and more intuitive. Remote Config custom signals, Firestore backup scheduling Updates on Firebase Remote Config Custom Signals and Custom Signal Conditions, Crashlytics Event-Specific Custom Keys, AI Assistance In Crashlytics, and more! Specials 📕 KMP for Mobile Native Developers: The Book. Santiago Mattiauda's book on using Kotlin Multiplatform for mobile native development.

title: Android Weekly Issue #660
description: Articles & Tutorials Sponsored App Center Retirement: Why Sentry is Your Next Step Visual Studio App Center is retiring, but sadly….you’re not. See how to make the switch to Sentry for all your crash reporting needs. Migrating to the Compose PullToRefreshBox Joe Birch discusses the new experimental PullToRefreshBox composable in Jetpack Compose, highlighting its improved discoverability, readability, and reduced boilerplate compared to the previous pullRefresh modifier approach. BasicTextField bubble wrap Zach Klippenstein introduces a technique to add dynamic content padding to Jetpack Compose’s BasicTextField, enhancing user experience by adjusting padding based on scroll position. Sponsored Advertise your Android dev course to over 80k readers We reach out to more than 80k Android developers around the world, every week, through our email newsletter and social media channels. Advertise your Android development course! Effective Map Composables: Collections of Draggable Markers Uli Bubenheimer demonstrates managing collections of draggable markers in android-maps-compose, focusing on marker state and collection changes. Exercise Caution When Using runBlocking on Android Jaewoong Eum advises caution when using Kotlin’s runBlocking in Android development, explaining that it can block the main thread and lead to Application Not Responding (ANR) errors, thereby degrading user experience. Seamless shimmer integration with existing Compose code Igor Escodro presents a method to integrate a shimmer effect into existing Jetpack Compose codebases with minimal modifications, utilizing a custom Modifier. Draw sleep timeline graph in Compose Viktor Mykhailiv provides a guide on creating a custom sleep timeline graph in Jetpack Compose, illustrating how to represent various sleep stages such as awake, REM, light, and deep sleep using the Canvas composable and DrawScope API. Dealing with READ_MEDIA_IMAGES Permissions in Android Dobri Kostadinov explains Android 13’s READ_MEDIA_IMAGES permission changes and demonstrates using a DialogFragment for image selection. The future is adaptive: Changes to orientation and resizability APIs in Android 16 Android 16 is removing the ability for apps to restrict orientation and resizability at the platform level, and shifting to a consistent model of adaptive apps that seamlessly adjust to different screen sizes and orientations. Production-ready generative AI on Android with Vertex AI in Firebase The Vertex AI in Firebase SDK lets you access Google’s Gemini Cloud models (like Gemini 1.5 Flash and Gemini 1.5 Pro) and add GenAI capabilities to your Android app. Meet the Android Studio Team with Product Manager, Paris Hsu The Android team's short blog series where they pull back the curtain and introduce you to the passionate people who build your favorite Android development tools. Exploring Kotlin’s Immutable Collections Library Ignacio Carrión explores Kotlin’s Immutable Collections library, highlighting its benefits for thread safety, performance, and efficient state management in Jetpack Compose. Libraries & Code flow-operators Flow operators that enable you to create restartable, pausable, or one-shot StateFlow instances, allowing you to customize and control additional behaviors for StateFlow based on your specific use case. News Build kids app experiences for Wear OS New Wear OS features enable ‘standalone’ watches for kids, unlocking new possibilities for Wear OS app developers. The First Beta of Android 16 The first beta of Android 16 is now available, which means it's time to open the experience up to both developers and early adopters. Helping users find trusted apps on Google Play Google is introducing a new way to recognize VPN apps that go above and beyond to protect their users: a "Verified" badge for consumer-facing VPN apps. Tools SVG to Jetpack Compose Icon Figma plugin that converts vector graphics directly into Jetpack Compose ImageVector code Videos & Podcasts Arrow for Everyone! - Part 2 - TypeAlias Show Dave Leeds shows how Arrow's features are helpful for everyone - no FP experience required! How to set up Android Picture-in-picture mode? Learn how to set up your Android app to switch to PiP mode with some extra user experiences bonus on top. Firebase Data Connect: SQL or NoSQL, that is no longer the question Firebase now has SQL. Yes, that's right! You can now choose between NoSQL and SQL when it comes to managing your data. Authentication on Android with Credential Manager and Firebase Auth Learn what Credential Manager and Firebase Authentication are, and how you can combine them to allow users to sign into your Android apps with their Google Accounts with just one tap. Sign in with Google flows with Credential Manager and Firebase Auth Dive deeper into the different authentication flows that you can have in your Android app when signing up or signing in your users with Sign in with Google. Implementing authentication with Credential Manager and Firebase Auth Learn how to get started with Sign in With Google in your Android app, using Firebase Authentication and Credential Manager. Dagger-Hilt vs. Koin vs. Manual Dependency Injection Philipp Lackner compares all common approaches to dependency injection on Android, highlight advantages and disadvantages and finally give you my recommendation to DI. Fast Feedback Loops & Composable Preview Scanner Jov Mit discusses fast feedback loops & Composable preview scanner with Sergio Sastre. Multi-Module KMP: The Ultimate Guide to Resource Sharing Multi-Module KMP: The Ultimate Guide to Resource Sharing Testing | Jetpack Compose Tips Behavior tests can use DeviceConfigurationOverride, a new testing API to simulate different device configurations to avoid needing multiple emulators to run a full test suite.
